Second brain

My second brain is a large collection of plain text files that I maintain as a repository for things I would like to retrieve later but don‚Äôt want to remember now. The public part of it can be found on this website, my digital garden.

‚ÄúSecond brain‚Äù is just a nifty new term for a concept that‚Äôs been around for ages: the commonplace book, and later ‚Äî I fantasize about Wall Street in the 90s with Filofax when I hear this term ‚Äî personal information management. These days, there‚Äôs a lot of talk online about personal knowledge management, but frankly, that term irks me a bit. It feels like people everywhere, including those with little original writing, have coopted the term from academics, and that makes me cringe. Nevertheless, here I am.

Tools

It‚Äôs important for me to remember * Tools don‚Äôt matter. The only thing that matters about a tool is that it must allow me to manipulate plain text or Markdown files that exist in a folder that I can move around freely.

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She has a keen interest in (digital) humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking.
